website_summaries.verdict: This unique cast iron design lets virtually anyone split firewood without putting fingers near a blade.
pros: Makes kindling without handling a sharp blade
Place firewood inside iron safety ring and strike with blunt object to drive wood onto splitting wedge
Makes it possible for almost anyone to split kindling
cons: Works best with softer wood pieces already smaller than 6 inches in diameter

customer_reviews.title: Our 8 Year Old Can split logs with this
customer_reviews.text: The video says it all, really. Super easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Julia Campbell

customer_reviews.title: He liked it before
customer_reviews.text: Husband had shoulder surgery - just before the heating season. Got this for him, and saw him picking up splits off the ground, so I cut the bottom out of a 8 gal plastic nursery pot, and voila ! no more bending over needed. He liked it before, and loves it now.
customer_reviews.author: Lila R.

customer_reviews.title: Best Kindling Tool you can buy. Built from Solid Cast Iron To Last Many Years.
customer_reviews.text: This really is the only way to split kindling. It's the ultimate tool that anyone can safely use. I actually split kindling right in the comfort of my living room. I located a suitable sized log which measured 15 inches high, by 12 inches in diameter and attached the Cracker using two wood screws. I cut out one side of a cardboard box to catch any wood chips, bark etc. And set the log in the center. I use the recommended 4lb Stanley Fatmax Hammer which I purchased as a combo with the cracker. Any lighter hammer would make splitting more difficult in my opinion. (See the photo) I would also recommend using eye protection during use.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Make spltting kindling a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, Makes splitting kindling a breeze. After using mine on the ground, then bolted to a log... I decided to saw off a bucket and mount the Kindling cracker in the bucket... on the log. Now the mess and the kindling stays in one place and is convenient when I want to build a fire. A few holes drilled around the side keep the water drained and the kindling dry.
customer_reviews.author: stripmine

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this tool is the best I've ever seen in a cast iron device. Makes splitting kindling a breeze. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have never chopped wood in my life and was scared to use an axe so thought this would be a good alternative. I put a piece of wood in the apparatus and whacked it over 100 times with a sledge hammer. All I got was a stuck piece of wood. Luckily I got a man (yes, I'm a helpless female) to get the wood split. I overcame my fear, got an axe, and it is WAY easier than this splitter was.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but don't over-estimate this
customer_reviews.text: I got this hoping to use it to split larger chunks of firewood into smaller logs. It does a fantastic job splitting relatively small pieces of wood into smaller kindling. It's also much safer than using an axe and stump. But, don't over-estimate how effective it will be with larger chunks of firewood. The total diameter of the top circle is larger than the pieces you can effectively split. If you split some larger rounds and don't quite get them small enough for this tool, you are still going to need a wedge or something else to finish splitting it.
customer_reviews.author: B4E1

customer_reviews.title: This is the original and it shows.
customer_reviews.text: This item is very sturdy and industrial feeling. Super easy to use just like the video shows. This is the original so don't get suckered by a cheaper knockoff. You really can't go wrong with this item. I'm using it for a fire pit, but if I was using it for larger pieces (6.5"+) for a home wood burner I would probably get the larger size. Just make sure you have a decent little hammer like a 3 lbs sledge. They say you can use another piece of wood, but that sounds rather awkward and not exactly an efficient way to use this tool.
customer_reviews.author: FRANK P KOWNACKI

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Poor Shipping Procedures!
customer_reviews.text: The Kindling Cracker is absolutely Awesome! It truly makes cutting kindling a breeze for anyone who uses it. BUT I would not EVER purchase this product (or any other) from Northern Tool + Equipment. The $87.19 total that I was charged you would expect better shipping procedures, but No. This product was "just shipped" from South Carolina to the west coast in it's original product box which was not strong enough to secure the cast iron Kindling Cracker, so the box arrived pretty beat up with 3/4 of the bottom torn exposing the product. The packing slip must of fallen out because it was re-taped to the outside top of the package. Live and Learn.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Best Kindling Maker Ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of those guys with an expensive (some would say ridiculously expensive) Swiss hatchet. I got this for Christmas and my smirk quickly turned into a smile. This is one of the best tools I've ever received, and that's saying a lot. Creating thin pieces of kindling is a BREEZE with this thing. I don't have mine attached to a log and simply let it sit on the ground. Works great and MUCH SAFER than making kindling with an axe or hatchet. Never miss again!!! I suggest using a 3-lb. hammer or the backside of that Swiss hatchet. ;)
customer_reviews.author: W. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Amazing at what it does, making big wood into little wood
customer_reviews.text: Pricey, but well made and worth it to me. You can't split logs with this, that is not what it was built for. It is built for splitting modest sized 1/4 pieces of firewood into smaller pieces. No more holding a wedge and hitting it on a small piece of wood, no more misses, or fumbles before you can split the wood. using gloves I hold the piece of wood on the top of the splitter with one hand, and give it a whack with a hammer with the other hand. Perfect split every time (so long as your wood isn't super knotty.
customer_reviews.author: NeoGeo

customer_reviews.title: We're on our 2nd winter of use and it's still amazing. My husband said one of the best Christmas ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 1 year ago for my husband for Christmas. We're on our 2nd winter of use and it's still amazing. My husband said one of the best Christmas gifts yet. We drilled it into an oversized log to set it up higher. Often times I'll split kindling while he loads up firewood in the house. It makes great use of those random short pieces that mess up the stack.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: You may like it so much you find yourself making kindling just for kicks - I did! It's fun to use and so simple anyone can split kindling without much effort or risk of injury. Plus it's portable and can be taken where ever the wood is. I wanted to take a star off because it really needs to have a slightly larger maximum diameter opening since I too often find wood that's slightly too big to fit. But as noted before, it works so well that I'm giving it a 5 anyway. Super product.
customer_reviews.author: Amaz878777

customer_reviews.title: Safe for kids
customer_reviews.text: We wanted out younger kids who can't swing a maul or were to young to safely use our hydraulic splitter to be able to participate in getting our winter wood pile ready. They already use their wagon to transport and help stack, but splitting wood is so much more "exciting" to them. This little unit is safer than anything we have seen or used for little folk. It is a little pricey but worth it. It is very sturdy, but I marked it down one star there because one of the days you can use it is with a hammer and I don't think the top ring with take very many errant blows. Errant blows would be very rare however.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Tiso

customer_reviews.title: You could more easily take a rock and smash the wood until it splinters
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't work at all, completely false advertising and a waste of money. You could more easily take a rock and smash the wood until it splinters than use this product... and their customer service is even worse
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: The Safest and Easiest Way to Split Logs
customer_reviews.text: We were camping in the UP this summer and the boyfriend was trying to split wood with an (admittedly cheap) axe. It probably wasn't going to end very well, until the gentlemen in the campsite next to us lent us this. You just put the wood log in the top hole, bang on it with a hammer, and woof the log easily splinters into smaller pieces. This one so far has held up well, and it's easy to use. It takes little force and is way safer than trying to hack something with an axe. If you go camping you should have this.
customer_reviews.author: ELL

customer_reviews.title: Efficient splitting
customer_reviews.text: Hubby just used his for the first time a few days ago. He loves it. We have a lot of smaller diameter Hawthorne trees (nasty thorny apple trees) that burn well if you can split them. Axes work but its tedious especially on the the smaller diameter trunks, but works just as well on the larger ones. This tool makes a joke out of the work. Its is simple to set up on blocks with a board and doesn't even need to be mounted. Wonderful to spend good money for good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonophile

customer_reviews.title: Great invention ... give the inventor a prize or an engineering scholarship
customer_reviews.text: My wife located this online. We've moved to a wooded lot on the Chesapeake Bay with a free-standing fireplace in the great room. So, much more need and opportunity for firewood. Our supplier provides good hardwood and mixed seasoned wood. Right length, but pieces are larger diameter than will burn well. Cracker does an excellent job of splitting. Safety advantage clearly comes from stationary rather than moving blade, and the wood being held in place vertically and at the right height with the Cracker attached to a 15 in stump. Previously, I had some close calls with a rebounding axe or hatchet. Great product all around.
customer_reviews.author: Bmore Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes splitting wood addictive.
customer_reviews.text: Splits wood almost effortlessly. I put the wood inside tap it with a 3 lb hammer to seat it slightly on the splitting edge. Prevents wood from popping out or tilting. Then continue with the 3 lb to finish the split.. Have split some so small and evenly they look like paint mixing sticks. Must admit it's addictive. I had to laugh, our 40 year old son tried it. Said " That's oddly satisfying " And it is, when have you said that about splitting wood? I bought another for our daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Sutphin Reed

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product, Works EXACTLY As Described!
customer_reviews.text: I don't even know what to say here.. Until I had this, I had no idea what I was missing. If you have larger firewood that you'd like to see burn more efficiently, this will meet your needs! Chop to fit the opening, and with a simple 4lb hammer, you'll be cracking your wood in no time. I don't know what I'd have done without it!
customer_reviews.author: Fritzie D. RosePuppy

customer_reviews.title: Girlfriend Loves It
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 50 yo girlfriend. She loves it! I bolted it to a heavy timber so it doesn't move around and is the right height. After using the hammer I left for her, She decided she needed her own and went and picked out a 2 pound fiberglass sledge hammer. She has a pretty swing but still hits the top ring a lot. I made a hammer saver by splinting a piece of heavy rubber hose and slipped over the top ring. Next? A kindling box for her. I may need to hide the hammer or there won't be any logs left.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I'd give this ten stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I saw this I knew I needed to have it. What a great invention and it works just as advertised. My previous methods to split wood weren't the safest and probably took twice as long. Balancing wood straight up to split isn't the easiest or safest when the bottom of the log isn't straight. I'd often be hitting the wood as it was tipping. Not good. This takes that problem out of the equation. Splitting wood using this definitely reduces your chances of muscle aches or injury. It also looks like it could last a lifetime. We'll see, Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Pete P. Poplawski

customer_reviews.title: Every wood burning home should have this splitter
customer_reviews.text: Used this kindling splitter today. I enjoy rustic, solid and functional tools. No more near misses is the hatchet and there is never a shortage of kindling.
customer_reviews.author: GWR

customer_reviews.title: A must have tool in your arsenal for cutting wood
customer_reviews.text: This is a must-have tool to use in your wood chopping kit. I have used this device multiple times at this point. If I could improve it, I would make the mouth of it a bit wider for slightly large pieces of wood. I know that this is for kindling :-) so, this is just a personal preference. I'd also include some mounting screws and an option to keep the wood from falling too far away from where it's being split. I know that some folks use a tire, etc. but everyone doesn't have a spare tire. The splitter is solid, weight-wise and makes my life so much easier for splitting wood for my fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Works4Me

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding! Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I only leave reviews for garbage products and outstanding products; this product is outstanding. Far exceeded my expectations. Super easy to use. Even the largest splits are “split” with ease. Solid build quality. Looks like it’ll last a lifetime. It also shipped far sooner than expected. I use it for splitting splits in half for my bbq smoker. A 4 pound mallet goes perfectly with it, it may even be a bit of overkill. A 3 pound would work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: tj6643

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, efficient and safe! Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I received this on Friday and spent 2 1/2 hours on Saturday splitting some seasoned and some not so seasoned firewood. I really liked how study and easy this tool worked making kindling. I split easily a 1/4 cord into 1 inch by 1 inch kindling. Overall design makes it much quicker, easier and safer than traditional axe or wedge and sledge approach. I feel confident in having my 13 year old using it without hurting himself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Modern design, Harkening to an earlier era
customer_reviews.text: After reading about this, Kindling Cracker Firewood Splitter, it just seemed to be the tool to buy for the chore at hand. This really is a great invention/design, and really works so stupidly well, that it's a wonder it wasn't invented hundreds of years ago. It is a tool, it is well made, I can't foresee it breaking and, therefore, one of those generational tools that can be handed down as an heirloom, in a technical sense.
customer_reviews.author: T. Robison

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: So you want some kindling..pieces are small, usually do not stand on the splitting log, hard to get the ax/hatchet started, never splits where you want, pieces go flying all over etc, etc...you wood burners know what I mean. This product solves ALL of these issues. Safe stable accurate no-chase kindling-and very well made. Pricey---worth it. Get the original. UPDATE>>>Well, pricey (I was going to buy 2 more for sons' Christmas gift) means going up $20.00 in one month..that seems steep..guess I will just lend them mine when they need kindling...
customer_reviews.author: Hal-Gordo

customer_reviews.title: I’d give this 10 stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: This splitter design is simply brilliant. It is so much easier to use than the traditional hatchet & maul. If your pieces are long enough, they even stay in the ring after you split so you don’t have to bend over to pick them up. The young lass that invented this is a true genius. If you have to make kindling, you should get one of these. My neighbor picked one up so he can split kindling while sitting down & drinking beer! Edit: We’re two seasons in on this now & still loving it. This product is built to last for sure & certain. Honestly, if you’re burning wood, do yourself a favor and get one!
customer_reviews.author: H. Burns

customer_reviews.title: So much easier and safer than the traditional way!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a Christmas gift for my 65 year old father as my mom was getting nervous watching him split kindling the old fashioned way. I was concerned this would be a gimmicky gift that fell flat, but he LOVES it for the ease of use. He called me on Christmas Day absolutely delighted with the elegant simplicity of this tool. We all rest a bit easier knowing he’s no longer at risk of losing an arm splitting kindling with a hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Clang! What a delightful sound!!
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? I am a fan of simple human-powered solutions, and this is the ultimate example of that. In fact, this is my second kindling cracker, I gave away my first one to a family member who also loves it. One advantage I hadn't expected is the satsfying ring of the cracker when it discharges a freshly split piece of wood. It is a sound you will quickly learn to love yourself.!
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Works as Promised!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one that we have purchased. We purchased this one for my mother-in-law, and yes it is easy enough for her to use it, but the grandsons come over and make all the kindling that she needs and it does it in no time at all. Everyone wants one now. As long as you have straight grain, it goes through with no troubles at all. Ours is under the cover of the woodshed and still looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: Lori A.

customer_reviews.title: Save your thumb!
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this product long ago. It took nearly cutting my thumb off while cutting kindling with a hatchet for me to realize that I needed this product if for no other reasons other than safety. The product is sturdy and simple to use. I mounted mine on a aspen round so that I had extra height to work with when hammering out kindling. In my opinion, this product is inexpensive when compared to an emergency room visit and stitches.
customer_reviews.author: rfw1953

customer_reviews.title: but this is a fine size and it gets used weekly in our house ...
customer_reviews.text: Probably would have gone with the larger version if purchasing again just because the last cord of wood we got was a bit larger than usual, but this is a fine size and it gets used weekly in our house for stocking kindling for the wood stove. I've smashed and pinched my fingers a few times splitting squirrely pieces of wood and swinging a small sledge can get a little tiresome, but after a while you do get a feel for which pieces are seasoned well enough to split easily and can just divide the pile accordingly for better results.
customer_reviews.author: Internet Person

customer_reviews.title: This is outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I'd buy this ten times over if I had to - luckily it's very heavy duty so I won't need to. Splitting logs is SO much easier (and safer) with this and a 3lb sledge hammer as opposed to an axe. The ring holds the wood upright, no matter if the bottom of the log is flat or angle cut. Set the wood on the blade against the ring and 2-3 whacks with a hammer and you have a split log.
customer_reviews.author: Luca Brasi

customer_reviews.title: Makes cutting kindling super quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today, the picture has all the kindling (in the upper right of the pile) that I cut in under 2 minutes from two logs. Don’t get the rip off spiltters out there. This one was a designed by a teenager in New Zealand for a school project, she marketed it and got deals with manufacturers to distribute her invention worldwide. Over the years, there about a dozen rip off products on amazon. Get the genuine KindingCracker with the HA logo (the inventor, Ayla Hutchinson‘s, initials)
customer_reviews.author: dbenham

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Got the smaller one have to use pretty small pieces of wood would get the bigger one if had to get it again Also don’t use any pieces of wood that had a branch that was cut off wood won’t split hardly because wood to hard around knot and bends metal on cutter edge very good idea but the metal needs to be better quality
customer_reviews.author: macus twain

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Sometime's takes a few swings of the mallet to finally split a piece; i'll have to get more accurate so I can swing harder. But overall, anything beats trying to hold a piece of wood in one hand and aim a hatchet and swing with the other. This kindling cracker makes things a lot easier, safer and quicker. And it looks nice. I like that it comes with bolt holes so it can be securely mounted on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Latios

customer_reviews.title: Quality product made in Australia
customer_reviews.text: It's really good. The casting was top-notch, not like something from the east. It's a quality item that if you don't leave it out in the rain it'll last for generations. A safe way to make kindling. I gave it a quick wipe down with fluid film, couldn't hurt. I mean it'll still work if it rusts but I like to look after my stuff, especially an item well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jordy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and it works! Easy!
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my husband who has lots of pain in his arm but loves a good fire and he loves it! We sometimes get wood that is very impractical to split and this tool was the perfect solution. not only does it make splitting wood easy but also portable, you can be in the grass or over gravel and keep working there. Very sturdy and good weight.
customer_reviews.author: Anania

customer_reviews.title: Fun Wood Splitter!
customer_reviews.text: Love this kindling maker! It is easy to use, sturdy, durable, and most of all fun! I literally could just make kindling for hours and I'd have no firewood left. I know this isn't quite as "manly" as using an ax the size of a dinosaur femur to split the logs, but it is MUCH easier. One of the keys to success with this product is to attach it to a tree trunk section like in the attached photo. It makes a huge difference. I called a local tree trimming service and got one for free.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This Cracker really works GREAT !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was curious about this invention. I had a lot of rounds of ash to split and couldn't do it with splitting maul. so I bought this 'cracker'. It works great. dropped in a log, secured it on blade, then smacked it with an 8lb sledge hammer and it split instantly. This ash was seasoned for at least 3 years and hard as steel.. so this little invention is amazing. used it on frozen ground, but would be nice to lag bolt it down onto a stump so it wont topple. I highly recommend this. a great addition to my 6 and 8lb splitting mauls.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Rawlins

customer_reviews.title: Just one additional design feature would put it over the top...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I no longer have to strike wood, and if it doesn't split, pry the axe out and start again. However, if they would have made this a two legged design, like the larger one, it would be perfect. Of course, that would probably eliminate the need for the larger, and more expensive one, as you could easily just mount this to a block with a gap beneath it for larger logs. I may end up grinding off the circular ends and mounting it that way. Still, a great addition to the woodshed, nonetheless!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Kindling without risk of injury
customer_reviews.text: My 15 y.o. uses the kindling splitter. He moves it into the garage when not in use to keep rust at bay. It's easy to move. To split the kindling he sets the splitter on something solid - a stump, perhaps - outside. It handles pieces of wood a good bit longer than 12 inches as mentioned in another review. Would recommend this to anyone tired of putting fingers at risk when splitting kindling.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Works great, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I thought this overpriced, but after using it, I’m happy with it. Very sturdy, stable, holds the wood in place. Splits oak easily. I wish it was a couple inches taller, some of the longer and bigger pieces of wood get jammed in the ring. This is much better than balancing a piece of wood on the splitting block and using the maul.
customer_reviews.author: southern NH

customer_reviews.title: Get cracking!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my hubby for Christmas. We have a wood fireplace in our home and he uses it to make our kindling for fire starter. It pleased me to find out later from one of his secretaries that he liked it so much that he took it in to his work and showed the guys how it worked. They thought it was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Gale

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for smaller fireplaces
customer_reviews.text: We dig this thing so much that we bought another for our neighbors. It's ridiculously easy to use with a 5-pound engineer's hammer. We place the splitter on a level tree trunk remnant and fire away. Although we'd like to bolt it to make it absolutely steady, that would make it difficult to remove the occasional log that gets wedged because it's too thick or knotty. In that case we turn it upside down and knock on the stuck log a few times and usually it pops right out.
customer_reviews.author: That Adorable Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Solid and well built; Splits kindling easily and safely
customer_reviews.text: After nicking myself last winter while splitting kindling for the wood stove, I decided to splurge on a Kindling Cracker Firewood Kindling Splitter. It's high quality, it splits wood easily, and there's no danger of nicking yourself. When it gets closer to burning season, I intend to mount it inside a box or other container (as other reviewers have demonstrated) to contain the splits. My only regret is that I didn't buy this gadget years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Persephone

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: So I was using an axe or hatchet to get the wood split up but this is certainly easier and safer by far. I would certainly recommend this. Especially handy for small kindling and the such to get small pieces. I'm using it in a few different ways.....kindling for a fire. Kindling for a Rocket Stove and kindling for small pizza oven. I had some super hard hickory that I even used on it and worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Glad I paid a few extra dollars for quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! We just moved to the mountains and as a city boy I was afraid of chopping off a finger using a hatchet all the time to split up kindling. Read review after review on all different brand and styles. I am so p,eased I didn’t go with a cheap knock off of this product. This thing works great! I bolted it to a tree stump and throw a Lowe’s bucket over it when I’m not using it. Love it! Made life so much easier and safer
customer_reviews.author: MXDad427

customer_reviews.title: Buy a wood splitting wedge for $10 instead
customer_reviews.text: Buy a wood splitting wedge for $10 instead. Shocked at all the 5 star ratings. Good idea but only works for smaller pieces of wood with short lengths. Long pieces easily get jammed when trying to split the wood and pieces wider than 6.5 inches don't fit. Larger and more expensive unit can only do pieces up to 9 inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: CDM

customer_reviews.title: What a fun "toy" this is!
customer_reviews.text: If you like splitting wood of any size....this is for you! I bought it to make smaller kindling for my kettle for on our deck. It works very well. It's very heavy and sturdy. I can't imagine this thing ever breaking! It's made very well. You can split it down to a sliver! I bought the 3# drop hammer and that works great. You want to make sure you have a good solid ground to set it on. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: H B Malicoat

customer_reviews.title: Easiest way to split wood for your fire needs
customer_reviews.text: Its heavy duty, sturdy, and easy to use. We don't own an ax or live in an area that needs a lot of firewood. We live in Southern California and only use wood for fire pits during camping or the fireplace during the winter when it dips into the 40's so this is a convenient way to split logs. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R. Carandang

customer_reviews.title: We both were able to use it easily. It's a solid
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I just opened it and used it for the first time today. We both were able to use it easily. It's a solid, heavy, attractive tool and looks just fine sitting on the hearth of our outside fireplace. We have property covered with relatively small cedar trees and this worked great on one of those logs. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Anne M. Toy

customer_reviews.title: Got wood? Get this Cracker! Safe easy and fast. Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 80 year old Father in law and I have never seen him so happy. I mounted it on a custom made base from extra 6x4 post beams taking up space in my garage. Usually he split wood as he burned, now he has almost a face cord split ahead. I tried it when I made the base, and I love it too. I see the big 8" version going on order soon, for my house. Got wood? Get this Cracker! Safe easy and fast. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C McRay

customer_reviews.title: Don't sit, split!
customer_reviews.text: This product has received great reviews for good reason. It is easy to use and does just what it is designed to do; making kindling fast and safely. I am also impressed by its design. It is cast iron and in one piece! There are no welds as far as I can tell. This makes rust and breakage less likely. One tip; mount the splitter onto a log with the two mounting holes provided. This makes it much easier and fun to use. In conclusion I can't say anything bad about this product. It is a triumph of design and function.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing works!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical but am really happy that I purchased. I bought the Fiskars axe at the same time and using the two together is making preparing for winter a real breeze. I would definitely recommend this product. It is so much safer than just swinging an axe to make kindling. It is a little expensive but now that I have it and realize how much easier and truly safer it is to use this device, I am very happy. Definitely recommend for others, especially if you are concerned about being steady using an axe.
customer_reviews.author: mamaseoul

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband, who loves it. I had one heck of a bad day and said, I really just want to smash something. He said I have just the thing, and let me split a bunch of firewood on this. It was so easy and so satisfying. Another bonus for me, the world's greatest klutz, is that this is SUPER SAFE TO USE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Probably works under ideal conditions... but not for me
customer_reviews.text: You are going to need relatively soft wood, even parallel grain, nice straight pieces, squarely cut ends, no twists or knots... then this is useful. Unfortunately this does not describe the mixed bag of wood that I typically get from my local tree service, so this item is effectively useless, or in the best case, no better than the sledge and wedge that I've been using for nearly 20 years, so I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this since i tend to have issues hitting the same spot with a splitting maul, and needed to be able to get small splits for my smoker.. This splitter is extremely handy, and even more sturdy than i expected. I was kind of gentle with it at first, but have found that i can use more force for stubborn logs.
customer_reviews.author: Network Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We live in north Idaho and have a fire in the fireplace almost every night, so we go through a lot of kindling. When possible we like to use cedar for kindling because it is easy to split and ignites easily. I bought the Kindling Cracker for my wife for Christmas and she loves it. It makes splitting kindling so much easier. No more chasing pieces as the fly away, no missing the wood with the axe and no potential injuries from missing with the axe. I anchored it with a couple of lag screws to a round of unsplit firewood and it's working great.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Larson

customer_reviews.title: make short work of making kindling
customer_reviews.text: Love this invention. I can make an impressive amount of kindling in just a short time. And being a bit long in the tooth myself, I can sit on my garden bench whilst cracking said kindling, saving my back for the job of hauling the wood into the house.....The thing I wish it had, was some kind of sheath to put on the blade when not in use. I've jimmied a cardboard egg carton to cover it. I'm afraid that one of our outdoor cats might accidentally step into it and onto the blade ....
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Crone

customer_reviews.title: This thing is really awesome. It is kind of expensive
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really awesome. It is kind of expensive, but for the quality of the tool it is worth it in my opinion. I'm a young guy in my early 30s and I'm pretty sure I'll still be using it when I'm an old man. It feels like a buy it for life product. It saves me a ton of time. I can fill up my kindling box in just a few minutes, and it is so much safer to boot!
customer_reviews.author: cuelco

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: As we are "maturing" the need for kindling remains but the accuracy is starting to wane, so for safety sake we got one of these. A med sledge hammer does the trick. Instant kindling with OUT the possibility of any accidents vs using an axe. It is heavy & can be attached to something if you want, but we have not felt the need to do that. It's very stable. It arrived on time & undamaged. GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Randye

customer_reviews.title: A must-have if you use a wood stove
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most useful things I own. It truly does make chopping kindling as easy as it looks in the product demos. Much safer than using a hatchet. It is very sturdy and heavy enough to stay put even when you’re splitting hard wood. Everyone with a wood stove needs one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Dude from VA

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality and utility
customer_reviews.text: This product is ideal for creating kindling from split hardwood. Very safe and easy to use (with my short-handled sledgehammer). The only drawback is that it only accepts wood up to the diameter of it ring at the top. Generally works find for split wood, though. May be a bit pricey for some people, but I like my fingers and would like too keep all of them as long as possible.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Will never use an axe again
customer_reviews.text: Never will I be outside hacking away at logs again to get me kindling isn't branches from the yard. This tool is nothing short of amazing. Put a log into it, hit it with a short handled sledge hammer - repeat a few times - and you have box full of kindling. Everyone I have recommended this to loves it. If you have a fireplace or wood stove, this is a must have addition.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: We live in the Sierra and, in addition to our regular heating, we enjoy having fires during cold weather. I've learned not to order stuff for my husband Jim without checking with him first. I did, and he was skeptical but said he'd give it a try. It came the other day, he's used it a couple of times, and is pleased. Jim says it takes less force to split the wood and is definitely safer. 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Prince

customer_reviews.title: It works as a kinkling cracker, but...
customer_reviews.text: It needs to be taller so that the pieces of wood can be completely split. Otherwise, you have to move them over to the side, essentially off of the iron frame, to finish the "cracking" external to the frame. Not a big deal until you're trying to split lots of kindling...
customer_reviews.author: Savanna S.

customer_reviews.title: Keep your fingers and hands safe!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend after watching him balance a piece of wood, swing the ax, then quickly pull his hand away from the wood, to make kindling. At first he said “I don’t need that”, but now he says he can’t imagine splitting kindling without it. He can split a pile of kindling so much faster now. And I don’t worry about him cutting his hand or fingers off. Worth every penny I spent.
customer_reviews.author: Triker

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Intermdiate Pieces
customer_reviews.text: I use this splitter to make oak intermediate pieces. The transition from a kindling fire to split logs is made easier with this product. I have been using this splitter to make 12 - 14 inch oak intermediate sticks. A great product for the transitional sized pieces of wood for fires.
customer_reviews.author: Karte Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good little splitter
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed some negative reviews on similarly priced items which brought be to this purchase. So far so good. Seems solid and while I haven't put it to work, I'm assuming it will hold up nicely. The piece looks like solid construction. Overall, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS WOOD SPLITTER
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be my favorite tool in my arsenal. We make a lot of campfires in our backyard so we go through a lot of wood. I am able to split wood effortlessly with just my 3# hammer, down to 1/4" thickness. I do wish it could accommodate wood that's a little larger than 6' diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: It's smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I screwed to good strong stump. Put in my first log(can't put too big of a log)and hit several times with a sledge. It worked well but my only complaint is why $100 for a piece of cast iron. I think someone is getting wealthy very quickly. Good idea but not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: OldSchoolJoe

customer_reviews.title: High quality, well made shipped fast, AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I can not believe how well this thing works. I got it today and immediately began testing it out. It works as advertised, amazingly. I put some very hard oak in there and was able to split it so easily. This beats trying to aim with an axe. If you need to split firewood, this is the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Dog

customer_reviews.title: Super easy and safe way to split kindling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 76 year old mom who heats with wood and coal. The first day she had it she split the equivalent of a large oil drum full of kindling while watching TV. She had been using a small sharp hatchet which was more risky for her and not as simple to do. This is safer and easier. Two thumbs up!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Burnside

customer_reviews.title: Beats buying bundles of camping firewood!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I had a bunch of small logs that the power company left after trimming the trees along the power line behind my house. I gathered them up and gave this thing a try. Made camping firewood kindling in no time. It split the logs with just a couple whacks with my 5-lb sledge hammer. Now looking for more little logs to whack up with my new toy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for intended use, splitting kindling
customer_reviews.text: This needs to be nailed down to work well, and mine is nailed onto an old stump. Very sharp, when used with a small sledge hammer I can do a week's kindling in about 15 minutes. Because of the height, it is easier on my back than an axe or wedges/sledge hammer/on the ground. This holds the wood upright. Larger pieces do not split easily, it is truly for smaller pieces to make into kindling. Think scrap lumber or limbs.
customer_reviews.author: S. Durston

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tool for the Wood Shed!
customer_reviews.text: I truly like the simplicity, sturdiness, and the effectiveness of this tool. No need to swing and ax or hatchet to split the smaller rounds of wood. With only a heavy hammer, you can split the smaller pieces safely and effectively. Nice tool!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roland Henson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The only log splitter you will ever need!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cool that I wish I had seen it years ago as I have wasted a lot of time trying to split wood with a sledge and wedge (unsuccessfully most of the time). This works slick and you can split a lot of wood in a short period of time to make those smaller pieces of firewood that burn much quicker and hotter. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Lake Newc

customer_reviews.title: GREAT way to chop kindling
customer_reviews.text: This was a game-changer for me in terms of ease of use. It is so easy to use and faster than chopping wood the traditional way. Very little effort is needed and you can easily split the kindling into finer and finer pieces, as needed. The ring is large enough to accommodate fairly big pieces and does a good job of holding the piece in place as you hammer it down. I cut a large 'thump stump' to set it on to save my back from excessive bending and it works beautifully. It is well built and will last for years.......i've had this one for 4 now..
customer_reviews.author: Diane Eichenlaub

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job producing kindling
customer_reviews.text: Was looking at electric log splitter at friends suggestion. Didn't want to spend $300 and try to find a place to store it when not in use. As long as your rough cut lumber will fit through the top you can make kindling. This has worked out well.
customer_reviews.author: Alan L

customer_reviews.title: The only way this would come close to working is if you BOLT it down to a tree stump
customer_reviews.text: The only was this would come close to working well is if you BOLT it down to a tree stump. Otherwise it is useless. Nice sturdy forged iron and its quite heavy but not for us . Does have holes located where you CAN bolt it to a tree stump.
customer_reviews.author: Spacey

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kindling splitter. Works on lumber scraps or pieces of firewood. I do recommend the larger one if you are just using pieces of regular firewood. Sometimes the pieces get jammed inside the top ring but they pull out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Gray

customer_reviews.title: Easier than an axe with multi-usage
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I use a 5 lb mini handheld sledge hammer to pound the log down over the blade and it works every time. To splitting logs in half or positioning the log over the blade to make kindling. Much easier than using an axe in my basement to do the same work.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, easy, fun. A must for all fire pits!
customer_reviews.text: Once secured on a heavy timber, stump or large block, this heavy, well built, cleverly designed tool makes short work of spitting medium logs into convenient firewood. We use ours specifically for our backyard fire pit. Whatever size firewood you want is easily determined by you. Large logs do need to be split first to fit inside the ring. But I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K. Kay

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool
customer_reviews.text: I would seriously give this 6 stars if I could. Counter-intuitive idea that works amazingly well. I’ll even go out to make kindling if I don’t even need it because I’m just so enchanted by it. Lost count of how many people I told about this.
customer_reviews.author: Scallywag

customer_reviews.title: Excelent tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: The splitter works a little different than I thought but it works well and saves time and fingers. very easy to use. There is a wedge at the top of the center piece that splits the wood. the fingers come from it serves to push the wood away. It is simplistic and simple but heavy duty built and works.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis E. Weldon

customer_reviews.title: Use to make kindling, sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. I can use a hand held sledge hammer or a full size one. Wood splits easily into small pieces. This will not fit large logs. This is built to split smaller half logs of wood and does a great job at exactly that.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Very safe and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Mounted it to a 2x12 board for stability. Works great to split wood into smaller pieces without wielding an axe. Can let my son split now without worrying about chopping his finger off while he holds the log. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: phan

customer_reviews.title: Good tool. Just watch out for weak frame structure build.
customer_reviews.text: Well first time using it and it snapped after about 10 small logs I just ax/spit into 1/4’s Received it on May 7th and after Mother’s Day I decided to get some kindling ready for the weekend coming up. Not sure if I got a defective one? Overall its a handy tool. Just not a good experience for me from the start.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE R.

customer_reviews.title: Genius Product- will last for years
customer_reviews.text: Great product! No more axe swings for smaller pieces of wood. Use with 4 pound hammer. Makes perfect sized pieces of wood for fireplace. Very well made. Heavy metal. Bolted to stump and was using in 5 minutes. Bolts not included though.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad-NY

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Yea! Something that actually works like it's supposed to. I wish I had one of these years ago. Heavy, simple but well engineered, it makes a chore less a chore and should stand up to years of use.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Brewster

customer_reviews.title: One of the greatest things of all time.
customer_reviews.text: Civilization was built on the basis of man being able to control fire. I have gone from beating on logs with all sorts of implements like our long lost Neanderthal cousins to simply popping a bit of wood into this splitter and owning the night. If we would have had this sooner we'd probably already have flying cars and men on Mars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Avoid if you plan on using oak wood
customer_reviews.text: Attempted to use on oak wood. This wood splitter did not work at all when I attempted to use oak. This product might work with softer woods, but with harder woods it is completely worthless. I was pounding away with a small sledge hammer for over fifteen minutes and it barely made a dent in the wood. Look elsewhere if you plan on splitting harder wood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes great kindling
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect for splitting logs ready for a fire. The cast iron construction is sturdy and has holes if you need to mount it to a surface. We do not need this to make kindling. The blade is sharp enough to split the log and takes three solid hammer throws to split a log. This device seems safe as the wood is contained during the splitting process. We're very happy fire campers with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: body worker

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough good about the product
customer_reviews.text: LUV IT!!!! I'm new at all this firewood thing. I just got a woodburning fireplace insert last year and now I've learned how to get my fires going in 10 minutes or less thanks to the kindling cracker. I can fill up a large box with kindle in about 15 minutes. I can almost shave the wood into those thin long slivers that get the fire going fast. I can't say enough good about the product. Nice work to the young lady that invented it!
customer_reviews.author: kathryn w

customer_reviews.title: easy. fun for hours
customer_reviews.text: durable. easy. fun for hours. I love this thing. My kids take turns with the hammer to pound away. Unless you swing out of control, I can't see getting hurt doing this, regardless of age. we were able to make some pretty small diameter kindling pieces from quite a large piece of firewood. Best of all, the smaller pieces burn hotter with more visible flame and make for an overall better fire.
customer_reviews.author: Luke's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use to make kindling.
customer_reviews.text: We bolted this to a chunk of wood to make it convenient to use while sitting in a chair. It turns word into kindling very quickly. Recommend you use gloves while splitting wood so you don't smash your fingers by accident.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: I like this thing! Makes making kindling easier (not a breeze, but easier) You still have to swing the mallet, but your hands are out of the way and the small stuff doesn’t fly all over the place. Best mounted on a sturdy stump or similar. Sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Manitop

product_meta.title: Kindling Cracker Firewood Splitter - Kindling Splitter Wood Splitter Wood Splitting Wedge Manual Log Splitter Wedge
feature_bullets: A safe and easy way to make kindling with no moving blade or sharpened object passing by your hands
Splits firewood with less force than a standard axe
Made of high-quality cast iron in Australia

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,965 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
